intro: Ononis vaginalis var. vivianii, commonly known as the Vivian's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal remedies due to their mild astringent properties.
